title: Hawai'i Volcanoes National Park: Calendar
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Calendar             Calendar       Park Partners and Cooperating Associations sponsor activities that may or may not appear in our Events Calendar. Visit their websites for complete schedules: Friends of Hawaiʻi Volcanoes National Park Volcano Art Center          Keyword       By Date     Start Date      End Date          Search         Upcoming Events    Showing 17 results    Show ALL instances of recurring events   RSS Feed      Hawai'i Volcanoes National Park Realms and Divisions of Kahuku      Time: 9:30 AM to 11:30 AM Location: Hawai‘i Volcanoes National Park Kahuku Unit - Hwy 11 near mile marker 70.5 Fees: Free event     Saturday, August 6, 2016 Realms and Divisions of Kahuku is a moderately-difficult two-mile, two-hour guided hike on Kahuku Unit's newest trail, Pu'u Kahuku. View Details      Hawai'i Volcanoes National Park The Birth of Kahuku      Time: 9:30 AM to 11:00 AM Location: Hawai‘i Volcanoes National Park Kahuku Unit - Hwy 11 near mile marker 70.5 Fees: Free event     Sunday, August 7, 2016 Join us in exploring the rich geologic history of Kahuku. View Details      Hawai'i Volcanoes National Park A Walk into the Past - A Living History      Time: 10:00 AM to 11:00 AM,12:00 PM to 1:00 PM,2:00 PM to 3:00 PM Location: Kīlauea Visitor Center Fees: Free event - Park entrance fees apply     Tuesday, August 9, 2016 "A Walk into the Past" features a living history presenter, dressed in period costume and bringing back to life Thomas A. Jaggar, founder of Hawaiian Volcano Observatory and a prominent figure in the history of volcanology, the study of volcanoes. View Details      Hawai'i Volcanoes National Park ‘Ike Hana No‘eau - Experience the Skillful Work      Time: 10:00 AM to 12:00 PM Location: Kīlauea Visitor Center auditorium Fees: Free event - park entrance fees apply     Wednesday, August 10, 2016 Discover the healing properties of Hawaiian plants  View Details      Hawai'i Volcanoes National Park Stewardship at the Summit      Time: 9:00 AM to 12:00 PM Location: Kīlauea Visitor Center Fees: Free event - Park entrance fees apply     Saturday, August 13, 2016 Come help out the park and the 'aina (land) by cutting invasive himalayan ginger (Heydechium gardnerianum) on park trails. View Details      Hawai'i Volcanoes National Park ʻŌhiʻa Lehua      Time: 9:30 AM to 10:30 AM Location: Hawaiʻi Volcanoes National Park Kahuku Unit - Hwy 11 near mile marker 70.5  Fees: Free Event     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Learn about the vital role of ʻŌhiʻa lehua in native Hawaiian forests. View Details      Hawai'i Volcanoes National Park After Dark in the Park - Centennial Series      Time: 7:00 PM Location: Kīlauea Visitor Center auditorium Fees: Event is free, however your suggested $2.00 donation helps support park programs - Park entrance fees apply     Tuesday, August 16, 2016 The Establishment of Hawaii National Park View Details      Hawai'i Volcanoes National Park After Dark Out of the Park      Time: 7:00 PM Location: Mokupāpapa Discovery Center in downtown Hilo - 76 Kamehameha Ave Fees: Free event     Wednesday, August 17, 2016 Park Archeologist Dr. Jadelyn Moniz-Nakamura shares the story of the development of Hawaii National Park View Details      Hawai'i Volcanoes National Park Centennial Hike: Walk into the Past at Volcano House      Time: 10:00 AM to 11:00 AM Location: Meet at Kīlauea Visitor Center Fees: Event is free - Park entrance fees apply     Saturday, August 20, 2016 Take an easy walk with a park ranger to the historic Volcano House View Details      Hawai'i Volcanoes National Park Kahuku ‘Ohana Day      Time: 10:00 AM to 2:00 PM Location: Hawai‘i Volcanoes National Park Kahuku Unit - Hwy 11 near mile marker 70.5 Fees: Free event     Saturday, August 20, 2016 Help restore the Kahuku forest by collecting and sorting new seeds View Details      Hawai'i Volcanoes National Park Puapo‘o Lava Tube Tour      Time: 11:30 AM to 2:30 PM Location: Meet at Thurston Lava Tube (Nāhuku) - Park at Kīlauea Iki Overlook and walk Crater Rim Trail .5 miles to Thurston Lava Tube Fees: $30.00 per adult - $25.00 per youth (7-12)     Saturday, August 20, 2016 The Puapo'o Lava Tube Tour is a moderate to challenging ranger guided hike through a tropical rain forest and fragile lava tube. View Details      Hawai'i Volcanoes National Park People and Lands of Kahuku      Time: 9:30 AM to 12:30 PM Location: Hawaiʻi Volcanoes National Park Kahuku Unit - Hwy 11 near mile marker 70.5 Fees: Free Event     Sunday, August 21, 2016 People and Lands of Kahuku is a moderate two-mile, three-hour guided hike. View Details      Hawai'i Volcanoes National Park After Dark in the Park      Time: 7:00 PM Location: Kīlauea Visitor Center auditorium Fees: Free event, however your suggested $2.00 donation helps support park programs     Tuesday, August 23, 2016 Oasis in a Desert Sea: Hawai‘i's Resident Whales and Dolphins View Details      Hawai'i Volcanoes National Park Nā Leo Manu Hawaiian Concert Series      Time: 6:00 PM to 9:00 PM Location: Hula performance at the Pā Hula near the Kīlauea Visitor Center at 6:00pm - Two Concerts at Kīlauea Visitor Center auditorium at 7:00pm Fees: Free event     Friday, August 26, 2016 Hawaiian music, hula and ‘oli (chant) open the fee-free NPS Centennial weekend at Hawai‘i Volcanoes National Park. View Details      Hawai'i Volcanoes National Park 36th Annual Hawai‘i Volcanoes National Park Cultural Festival & BioBlitz      Time: 10:00 AM to 3:00 PM,7:00 AM to 1:00 PM Location: Hawai‘i Volcanoes National Park Fees: Free event - Park entrance fees are waived for the National Park Service's birthday     Saturday, August 27, 2016 This year’s festival honors the park’s centennial anniversary View Details      Hawai'i Volcanoes National Park Hiʻiaka & Pele      Time: 9:30 AM to 11:00 AM Location: Hawaiʻi Volcanoes National Park Kahuku unit - Hwy 11 near mile marker 70.5 Fees: Free Event     Sunday, August 28, 2016 Discover two fascinating Hawaiian goddesses, sisters Pele and Hiʻiaka. View Details      Hawai'i Volcanoes National Park Puʻu o Lokuana      Time: 9:30 AM to 10:30 AM Location: Hawaiʻi Volcanoes National Park Kahuku unit - Hwy 11 near mile marker 70.5 Fees: Free Event     Sunday, September 4, 2016 Puʻu o Lokuana is a short, moderately difficult 0.4-mile hike. View Details
